contextId.information: This can be stated positively. AT: "made all the things he prophesied happen" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
contextId.quote: let none of his prophetic words fail to come true

contextId.information: This is a litotes that can be stated in the positive form. AT: "your rule will end soon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
This is stated in a negative way to emphasize the slaughter. It can be stated in positive form. AT: "let us kill every one of them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
contextId.quote: let us not leave one of them alive

contextId.information: This is stated as a negative to emphasize that God tells the truth. This can be stated in positive form. AT: "will always tell the truth and do what he says" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
contextId.quote: will not lie nor change his mind

contextId.information: This is stated as a negative to emphasize that God is trustworthy. This can be stated in positive form. AT: "he is God, and will do what he says he will do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
contextId.quote: he is not a man, that he should change his mind

contextId.information: David is pointing out how he and his men offered protection to Nabal's servants and flocks. This can be stated in positive form. AT: "we kept them and all their property from harm" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
contextId.quote: we did them no harm, and they missed nothing

contextId.information: This can be stated positively and in active form. AT: "he still has everything that was his" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: nothing was missed of all that belonged to him
